docs.snippet: The International Monetary Fund is expected to publish a list of 17 countries that will be the first to draw funds from the facility the agency set up to help finance the oil-related deficits of member nations, monetary sources said here today.
docs.lead_paragraph: The International Monetary Fund is expected to publish a list of 17 countries that will be the first to draw funds from the facility the agency set up to help finance the oil-related deficits of member nations, monetary sources said here today.
docs.abstract: IMF is expected to publish list of 17 countries that will be 1st to draw funds from facility agency set up to help finance oil-related deficits of member nations (S)

headline.main: 17 LANDS EXPECTED TO USE I.M.F. OIL AID

headline.main: News Summary and Index; The Major Events of the Day International National Metropolitan The Other News Quotation of the Day CORRECTION.

docs.snippet: President Juan Maria Bordaberry indicated today that the ban on political activity would not be lifted in the foreseeable future. Mr. Bordaberry has ruled with military backing since he dissolved Parliament last year.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Juan Maria Bordaberry indicated today that the ban on political activity would not be lifted in the foreseeable future. Mr. Bordaberry has ruled with military backing since he dissolved Parliament last year.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Pres Juan M Bordaberry indicates that Sept 4 ban on pol activity would not be lifted in foreseeable future; adds that election scheduled for '76 could not be held until Const, which is suspended, is reformed; cites changing concepts of pol representation in world and chastizes polticians for assuming that they truly represent people (S)

headline.main: Uruguayan President Indicates Ban on Politics Will Be Kept; Final Jurists' Report To Remain 5 to 20 Years

docs.snippet: Three Latin - American countries today formally proposed to the Organization of American States that the group consider lifting its decade-old political and economic sanctions against Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: Three Latin - American countries today formally proposed to the Organization of American States that the group consider lifting its decade-old political and economic sanctions against Cuba.

headline.main: 3 Latin Nations Ask An End to Cuba Ban; 3 Nations Ask O.A.S. to End Cuba Ban

docs.snippet: Three Latin -American countries today formally proposed to the Organization of American States that the group consider lifting its decade-old political and economic sanctions against Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: Three Latin -American countries today formally proposed to the Organization of American States that the group consider lifting its decade-old political and economic sanctions against Cuba.
docs.abstract: reprs of Colombia, Costa Rica and Venezuela on Sept 6 submit proposal to OAS Permanent Council pres Nander Pitty of Panama to formally propose that OAS consider lifting pol and econ sanctions against Cuba; 3 countries have joined Mex, Argentina, Peru, Panama, Jamaica, Barbados and Trinidad-Tobago that have either ignored sanctions or decided to override them in bilateral relations with Cuba; Ecuador, Honduras and El Salvador have gone on record as wishing to abolish sanctions; only firm opponents to lifting sanctions are reptdly Brazil, Paraguay, Chile and Bolivia; prime aim of US policy in hemisphere now is to prevent Cuban question from disturbing US's relations with other Latin-Amer countries; US State Dept denies rept that Cuba's Foreign Min Raul Roa had met US diplomats in Bern, Switzerland (M)

headline.main: 3 Latin Nations Ask An End to Cuba Ban

docs.snippet: Much like the monster creations of science fiction, the northward swarming of vicious African honeybees through South America is causing such concern in the United States that steps are being taken to control or neutralize them before they become a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Much like the monster creations of science fiction, the northward swarming of vicious African honeybees through South America is causing such concern in the United States that steps are being taken to control or neutralize them before they become a threat here.
docs.abstract: comment on repts that scientists are near breakthrough in eliminating defects in new protein-rich variety of corn, known as opaque-2, that could help alleviate malnutrition in some underdeveloped nations; new strain surpasses beef and milk in protein content; described (S)

docs.snippet: LONDON-The mountains are moving to Mohammed. Without Premier Fidel Castro's having to take a step, most of Latin America is going his way and pressures are building up in the United States for a 'change in policy toward Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON-The mountains are moving to Mohammed. Without Premier Fidel Castro's having to take a step, most of Latin America is going his way and pressures are building up in the United States for a 'change in policy toward Cuba.
docs.abstract: H L Matthews discusses Latin Amer efforts toward Cuban re-entry into OAS and pressure for US change in policy toward Cuba; cites resignation of Richard M Nixon, changed attitude toward internatl Communism, worldwide econ crisis and greatly improved Cuban situation as signs approaching end of Cuba's isolation in Western Hemisphere; discusses change in Castro Govt as meaning that Latin Amer and US will have to negotiate with different and far stronger Cuba
